activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:01 AM 22CF30/21CT26/ 22CF130 - Defendant Nicholas J. Williams in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Nicholas J. Williams for 22CF30/21CT26.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson appears in person for NW for case 22CF130.

22CF130 - Defendant has received the complaint. Max penalties stated. Court speaks about the defendant rights to a preliminary hearing. Attorney Erickson waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. 

Court states that 22CF30 would be needing a preliminary hearing as well. Attorney Richards asks for a preliminary hearing to be set and a waiver will be presented if needed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:13 AM Defendant Nicholas J. Williams in court.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Nicholas J. Williams.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal has review the complaint and asks for a preliminary hearing outside of the time limits. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included with the exeption that the defendant is allow at Turbos during his work schedule which is Wednesdays from 5 PM to 9 PM, Fridays from 3 PM to 10 PM and Saturdays from 3 PM to 10 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:02 AM 21CT26/22CF30 - Defendant Nicholas J. Williams appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal asks for an adjourn initial appearance in 22CF30 to review the complaint with her client.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Harper appears for the state. Attorney McDougal appears for NW in person. NW appears by phone. Attorney McDougal asks for the bond to be amended to add Thursdays 5-9 for working at Turbos. No objection. Court amends bond and reset for March 9th at 9 AM

AMENDED:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included with the exeption that the defendant is allow at Turbos during his work schedule which is Wednesdays from 5 PM to 9 PM, Thursdays from 5 PM to 9 PM, Fridays from 3 PM to 10 PM and Saturdays from 3 PM to 10 PM.
To Those Posting Cash Bond

Appearances: Judge Sharp, SKK Court Reporter, DA Harper for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail with Attorney McDougal

Recommendation on bail from the State:
$4,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Defense/Defendant comments:
Attorney McDougal states that he can't post $4,000 but may be able to post at $2,000. Defendant asks for a signature bond.
Attoney McDougal asks that there be an exception to allow defendant to work at turbos on Wednesday 5 - 9, Friday 3-10 and Saturday 3-10

Court Orders:
$2,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included with the exeption that the defendant is allow at Turbos during his work schedule which is Wednesdays from 5 PM to 9 PM, Fridays from 3 PM - 10 PM and Saturdays from 3 PM to 10 PM.


Next Appearance set for 03/02/22 at 11 AM
